taxon_identification.taxon_hierarchy: family asteraceae;tribe astereae;genus xanthisma;section blepharodon;species grindelioides;variety grindeloides

bio:treatment.description: Plants tufted, 10–35 cm. Leaves evenly distributed along stems, margins usually ciliate, sometimes spinulose-dentate, bristles usually 0.5–1.5 mm. Heads 1 or often 2–5. Peduncles 0.5–2 cm, often bracteate to proximal to heads. 2n = 8.
Gypseous or sandy plains or badlands;
Alta., Sask.; Ariz., Colo., Idaho, Mont., Nebr., Nev., N.Mex., N.Dak., S.Dak., Utah, Wyo.
bio:treatment.discussion: Variety grindeloides is known to hybridize with Xanthisma coloradoense in southern Wyoming.
